com.isoterik.mgdx.utils

Class WorldUnits

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.isoterik.mgdx.utils.WorldUnits

  • public class WorldUnits
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides convenient methods for working with both world units and screen (pixel) units.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WorldUnits(float pixelsWidth, float pixelsHeight, float pixelsPerUnit)
      Creates a new instance given the pixel dimensions of the game world and the pixels per meter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WorldUnits

        public WorldUnits(float pixelsWidth,
                  float pixelsHeight,
                  float pixelsPerUnit)
        Creates a new instance given the pixel dimensions of the game world and the pixels per meter.
        Parameters:
        pixelsWidth - number of horizontal pixels
        pixelsHeight - number of vertical pixels
        pixelsPerUnit - how many pixels make one world unit

    • Method Detail

      • toWorldUnit

        public float toWorldUnit(float pixels)
        Converts a given pixel value to an equivalent world unit
        Parameters:
        pixels - the pixels
        Returns:
        the world unit equivalent of the given pixels

      • toPixels

        public float toPixels(float unit)
        Converts a given world unit value to an equivalent pixel value
        Parameters:
        unit - the world unit
        Returns:
        the pixel equivalent of the given world unit

      • toWorldUnit

        public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 toWorldUnit(float pixelsX,
                                                 float pixelsY)
        Converts a given pixel coordinate to an equivalent world unit coordinate
        Parameters:
        pixelsX - pixels on the x-axis
        pixelsY - pixels on the y-axis
        Returns:
        the position in world unit

      • toWorldUnit

        public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 toWorldUnit(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion region)
        Parameters:
        region - a texture region
        Returns:
        the dimension of the texture region in world unit
